title: Package Development Notes
text: Contains daily notes details things developed. Primarily following https://r-pkgs.org/.

title: Package Development Notes
text: Created functions extract Table 1 HSR components: hsr_extract_payment_summary individual functions. defined .R file grouped Rd file. Probably need clean. Stil debating default behavior pivoted data frame .

title: Package Development Notes
text: Added dependencies well: httr, readr, tibble Added inital tests functions Still notes global bindings
code: hsr_extract_coefficients: no visible binding for global variable     ‘Value’   pdc_datasets: no visible binding for global variable ‘issued’   pdc_datasets: no visible binding for global variable ‘modified’   Undefined global functions or variables:     Value issued modified  0 errors ✔ | 0 warnings ✔ | 2 notes ✖

title: Package Development Notes
text: Added package dependencies readxl, stringr, dplyr, tidyr, rlang use_package() Added unit testing structure use_testthat(); created initial (toy) test use_test("hsr_extract_coefficients") Added README file usethis::use_readme_rmd() built default .md file build_readme() Added NEWS.md use_news_md() Added badges (anticipation): use_cran_badge(), use_coverage(), use_github_action("check-standard") Added logo (created hexmake + ChatGPT): use_logo() Started package website use_pkgdown() pkgdown::build_site() get initial site used usethis::use_pkgdown_github_pages() create GitHub Actions workflow update site commit/push. automatically configures GitHub (branch created Pages configured). need push site pkgdown stuff yet. Made inst/extdata/ directory Went QualityNet downloaded FY 2025 HSR (https://qualitynet.cms.gov/inpatient/hrrp/reports#tab3) (11/8/2025 @ 11:56 CST). Added file directory. suggested (https://r-pkgs.org/data.html#sec-data-example-path-helper) created new helper function hsr_example() help identify file users. use_r("hsr_example"). copied exact function definition (changes reflect current package). Added documentation. Added unit test ensure example file exists user file system. final check(), still one (expected) note (resolve later) ``` ❯ checking package subdirectories … NOTE Problems news ‘NEWS.md’: news entries found. ❯ checking R code possible problems … NOTE hsr_extract_coefficients: visible binding global variable ‘Value’ Undefined global functions variables: Value 0 errors ✔ | 0 warnings ✔ | 2 notes ✖ ❯ checking R code possible problems … NOTE hsr_extract_coefficients: visible binding global variable ‘Value’ Undefined global functions variables: Value 0 errors ✔ | 1 warning ✖ | 1 note ✖ ``` Starting next…
code: * Added all FY mock reports to `extdata`. Used `rename_files("hsr_example", "hsr_mock_reports")` to rename the function to be more explicit. Changed all required areas to accomodate change.  # 11/5/2025  * Initialized package by creating repo here: https://github.com/centralstatz/readmit * Then created _New Folder from Git_ in Positron, cloning that repo * Then used `usethis::create_package(getwd())` to initialize package template * Added this file `DEVNOTES.md` to `.Rbuildignore` * Ran `usethis::use_r("hsr_extract_coefficients")` to create the packages first function, which extracts the list of model coefficients from a CMS Hospital Specific Report (HSR) for a specified cohort. Added argument checks. * Used `devtools::load_all()` to test it (works on locally downloaded report). * Did initial `devtools::check()` and got various warnings/notes, which is expected because nothing was configured yet. * Edited the `DESCRIPTION` file (with possibly to change over time as package evolves), and added MIT license with `usethis::use_mit_license()` * Added `roxygen2` documentation to function. Used `devtools::document()` to document it. Added `\dontrun` to roxygen for function as example doesn't work yet. Need to put external data in the package. * Still have warning/note as I haven't declared dependencies, so will do that soon.

what: Tools for navigating, managing, and analyzing hospital readmissions

title: Tools for navigating, managing, and analyzing hospital readmissions
text: can install development version readmit GitHub :

what: Extract model coefficients from a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_extract_coefficients
title: Extract model coefficients from a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_extract_coefficients
text: Parses regression coefficients logistic regression model used CMS estimate discharge-level readmission risk, including hospital-level hospital average intercept terms.

title: Extract model coefficients from a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_extract_coefficients
Extract model coefficients from a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_extract_coefficients
text: file File path report cohort Cohort extract coefficients . One c("AMI", "COPD", "HF", "PN", "CABG", "HK")

title: Extract model coefficients from a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_extract_coefficients
text: tibble containing columns Factor Value model term coefficient value, respectively (linear-predictor scale).

title: Extract model coefficients from a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_extract_coefficients
code: my_report <- hsr_mock_reports("FY2021_HRRP_MockHSR.xlsx") hsr_extract_coefficients(my_report, "AMI") #> # A tibble: 33 × 2 #>    Factor                                                                Value #>    <chr>                                                                 <dbl> #>  1 "Age Minus 65"                                                      0.00998 #>  2 "Male"                                                             -0.0937  #>  3 "Anterior Myocardial Infarction \r\n"                               0.272   #>  4 "Non-Anterior Location of Myocardial Infarction"                    0.0160  #>  5 "History of Coronary Artery Bypass Graft (CABG) Surgery"            0.00330 #>  6 "History of Percutaneous Transluminal Coronary Angioplasty (PTCA)" -0.0108  #>  7 "Severe Infection; Other Infectious Diseases"                       0.0181  #>  8 "Metastatic Cancer and Acute Leukemia"                              0.247   #>  9 "Cancer"                                                            0.0309  #> 10 "Diabetes Mellitus (DM) or DM Complications"                        0.181   #> # ℹ 23 more rows

what: Extract payment summary information a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_extract_payment_summary
title: Extract payment summary information a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_extract_payment_summary
text: Parses Table 1 Hospital-Specific Report, either altogether single output component individually.

title: Extract payment summary information a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_extract_payment_summary
code: hsr_extract_payment_summary(file)  hsr_count_dual_eligible_stays(file)  hsr_count_total_stays(file)  hsr_dual_proportion(file)  hsr_peer_group(file)  hsr_neutrality_modifier(file)  hsr_payment_adjustment_factor(file)  hsr_payment_penalty(file)

title: Extract payment summary information a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_extract_payment_summary
text: file File path report

title: Extract payment summary information a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_extract_payment_summary
text: tibble containing columns Measure Value metric value, respectively.

title: Extract payment summary information a Hospital-Specific Report (HSR) — hsr_extract_payment_summary
code: my_report <- hsr_mock_reports("FY2021_HRRP_MockHSR.xlsx") hsr_extract_payment_summary(my_report) #> # A tibble: 6 × 2 #>   Measure                                           Value #>   <chr>                                             <dbl> #> 1 Number of Dual Eligible Stays (Numerator) [a]  2932     #> 2 Total Number of Stays(Denominator) [b]        27178     #> 3 Dual Proportion [c]                               0.108 #> 4 Peer Group Assignment [d]                         1     #> 5 Neutrality Modifier [e]                           0.961 #> 6 Payment Adjustment Factor [f]                     1.000

what: Get path to mock Hospital-Specific Reports (HSR) — hsr_mock_reports
title: Get path to mock Hospital-Specific Reports (HSR) — hsr_mock_reports
text: Provides location mock HSRs downloaded QualityNet come package users can import. files representation hospital's real report looks like received CMS. contain mock data sensitive fields (discharge level data, etc.), real data national level results (e.g., model coefficients). Thus, gives user ability practice/explore package functions translate hospital reports. Files include fiscal years (FY) 2019-2025 downloaded 11/8/2025 https://qualitynet.cms.gov/inpatient/hrrp/reports. File names changed better identifiability.

title: Get path to mock Hospital-Specific Reports (HSR) — hsr_mock_reports
Get path to mock Hospital-Specific Reports (HSR) — hsr_mock_reports
text: path Name file. NULL, files listed.

title: Get path to mock Hospital-Specific Reports (HSR) — hsr_mock_reports

what: List the datasets available in the Provider Data Catalog (PDC) — pdc_datasets
title: List the datasets available in the Provider Data Catalog (PDC) — pdc_datasets
text: Provides names, identifiers, associated metadata datasets available CMS Provider Data Catalog (PDC) (https://data.cms.gov/provider-data/). can used explore dataset contents/metadata /used identifying datasets import pdc_read.

title: List the datasets available in the Provider Data Catalog (PDC) — pdc_datasets
List the datasets available in the Provider Data Catalog (PDC) — pdc_datasets
text: topics topic list datasets (see pdc_topics). NULL, datasets returned.

title: List the datasets available in the Provider Data Catalog (PDC) — pdc_datasets
text: tibble containing dataset metadata. Specifically, entry datasetid column can used pdc_read.

title: List the datasets available in the Provider Data Catalog (PDC) — pdc_datasets
code: pdc_topics() #>  [1] "Dialysis facilities"                    #>  [2] "Doctors and clinicians"                 #>  [3] "Home health services"                   #>  [4] "Hospice care"                           #>  [5] "Hospitals"                              #>  [6] "Inpatient rehabilitation facilities"    #>  [7] "Long-term care hospitals"               #>  [8] "Nursing homes including rehab services" #>  [9] "Physician office visit costs"           #> [10] "Supplier directory"                     pdc_datasets("Hospitals") #> # A tibble: 67 × 7 #>    datasetid topic     title       description issued     modified   downloadurl #>    <chr>     <chr>     <chr>       <chr>       <date>     <date>     <chr>       #>  1 wue8-3vwe Hospitals Ambulatory… This file … 2025-07-16 2025-06-27 https://da… #>  2 4jcv-atw7 Hospitals Ambulatory… A list of … 2025-07-16 2025-06-27 https://da… #>  3 axe7-s95e Hospitals Ambulatory… This file … 2025-07-16 2025-06-27 https://da… #>  4 hbf-map   Hospitals Birthing F… A list of … 2025-07-09 2025-07-16 https://da… #>  5 muwa-iene Hospitals CMS Medica… This data … 2020-12-10 2025-07-16 https://da… #>  6 ynj2-r877 Hospitals Complicati… Complicati… 2023-07-05 2025-07-16 https://da… #>  7 qqw3-t4ie Hospitals Complicati… Complicati… 2020-12-10 2025-07-16 https://da… #>  8 bs2r-24vh Hospitals Complicati… Complicati… 2020-12-10 2025-07-16 https://da… #>  9 z8ax-x9j1 Hospitals Complicati… Prospectiv… 2024-07-31 2025-07-16 https://da… #> 10 jfnd-nl7s Hospitals Complicati… Prospectiv… 2024-07-31 2025-07-16 https://da… #> # ℹ 57 more rows

what: Import a dataset from the Provider Data Catalog (PDC) — pdc_read
title: Import a dataset from the Provider Data Catalog (PDC) — pdc_read
text: Imports complete dataset CMS Provider Data Catalog (PDC) (https://data.cms.gov/provider-data/). Dataset identifiers can discovered webpage /pdc_datasets.

title: Import a dataset from the Provider Data Catalog (PDC) — pdc_read
Import a dataset from the Provider Data Catalog (PDC) — pdc_read
text: datasetid dataset identifier (see pdc_datasets). ... Additional arguments passed read_csv

title: Import a dataset from the Provider Data Catalog (PDC) — pdc_read
text: tibble containing requested dataset.

title: Import a dataset from the Provider Data Catalog (PDC) — pdc_read
code: pdc_datasets("Hospitals") |> dplyr::filter(stringr::str_detect(title, "(?i)readmission")) #> # A tibble: 1 × 7 #>   datasetid topic     title        description issued     modified   downloadurl #>   <chr>     <chr>     <chr>        <chr>       <date>     <date>     <chr>       #> 1 9n3s-kdb3 Hospitals Hospital Re… In October… 2020-12-10 2025-01-08 https://da… pdc_read("9n3s-kdb3") #> Rows: 18510 Columns: 12 #> ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Delimiter: "," #> chr (11): Facility Name, Facility ID, State, Measure Name, Number of Dischar... #> dbl  (1): Footnote #>  #> ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data. #> ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message. #> # A tibble: 18,510 × 12 #>    `Facility Name`     `Facility ID` State `Measure Name` `Number of Discharges` #>    <chr>               <chr>         <chr> <chr>          <chr>                  #>  1 SOUTHEAST HEALTH M… 010001        AL    READM-30-AMI-… 296                    #>  2 SOUTHEAST HEALTH M… 010001        AL    READM-30-CABG… 151                    #>  3 SOUTHEAST HEALTH M… 010001        AL    READM-30-HF-H… 681                    #>  4 SOUTHEAST HEALTH M… 010001        AL    READM-30-HIP-… N/A                    #>  5 SOUTHEAST HEALTH M… 010001        AL    READM-30-PN-H… 490                    #>  6 SOUTHEAST HEALTH M… 010001        AL    READM-30-COPD… 130                    #>  7 MARSHALL MEDICAL C… 010005        AL    READM-30-CABG… N/A                    #>  8 MARSHALL MEDICAL C… 010005        AL    READM-30-HIP-… N/A                    #>  9 MARSHALL MEDICAL C… 010005        AL    READM-30-HF-H… 176                    #> 10 MARSHALL MEDICAL C… 010005        AL    READM-30-PN-H… 305                    #> # ℹ 18,500 more rows #> # ℹ 7 more variables: Footnote <dbl>, `Excess Readmission Ratio` <chr>, #> #   `Predicted Readmission Rate` <chr>, `Expected Readmission Rate` <chr>, #> #   `Number of Readmissions` <chr>, `Start Date` <chr>, `End Date` <chr>
